001package Calibration_Demos_More;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.ImageStack;
006import ij.io.LogStream;
007import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
008import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
009import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.CalibrationImage;
010import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
011import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
012import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.RectificationMapping;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
014import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
015import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
016import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
017import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
018
019/**
020 * This plugin opens an image stack containing the 5 Zhang
021 * test images and removes the lens distortion based on the calibrated 
022 * camera parameters. The resulting (rectified) frames are shown
023 * in a new image stack.
024 * 
025 * @author W. Burger
026 * @version 2021-08-22
027 */
028public class Demo_Rectification implements PlugIn {
029
030        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
031
032        private static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack_tif;   // = "CalibImageStack.tif"
033
034        static {
035                LogStream.redirectSystem();
036                PrintPrecision.set(6);
037        }
038
039        public void run(String arg0) {
040                // open the test image (stack):
041                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImage();
042
043                if (testIm == null) {
044                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!");
045                        return;
046                }
047                testIm.show();
048                String title = testIm.getShortTitle();
049
050                // get the camera intrinsics (typically by calibration):
051                Camera camera = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
052
053                // create a special geometric mapping
054                Mapping2D mapping = new RectificationMapping(camera);   // inverse, ie., maps target to source
055
056                // rectify the images and create a new stack:
057                ImageStack distStack = testIm.getStack();
058                final int w = distStack.getWidth();
059                final int h = distStack.getHeight();
060                final int M = distStack.getSize();
061                ImageStack rectStack = new ImageStack(w, h);
062                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
063                        IJ.showProgress(i, M);
064                        ImageProcessor source = distStack.getProcessor(i + 1);
065                        ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(w, h);
066                        ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(mapping, null, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
067                        mapper.map(source, target);
068//                      mapping.applyTo(source, target, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
069                        rectStack.addSlice("frame"+ (i + 1), target);
070                }
071                new ImagePlus(title + "-rectified", rectStack).show();
072        }
073
074}
